summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 regarding a request from Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for a report on inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves officials from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) discussing the formal process for obtaining the report.

persons.name: Dan Omar D.
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc'd) on an email regarding the request for an Epstein report from the BOP.

persons.name: Senior Deputy Assistant Director
persons.role: Senior Deputy Assistant Director of the Reentry Services Division, BOP
persons.context: The BOP official who initially inquires about the purpose of the SDNY AUSAs' request for a report on inmate Epstein and notes they have copied the Deputy General Counsel.

connections.description: Both are involved in the email chain regarding the formal request for a BOP report on Epstein.

events.title: BOP Inquiry about Epstein Report Request
events.description: A Senior Deputy Assistant Director at the BOP's Reentry Services Division emails to ask for more information about a request from SDNY AUSAs for a report on inmate Epstein.

events.title: OIG Suggests Formal AUSA Request for Epstein Report
events.description: An official from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) states they would be more comfortable with a formal request directly from an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) for the BOP report on Epstein.

keyFacts: Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) were actively seeking a report on inmate Jeffrey Epstein from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) in September 2020.
The request was related to the prosecution of co-conspirators (COs) charged in the Epstein case.
The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) preferred a formal request channel, stating they would be 'more comfortable with a formal request directly from an AUSA.'
The email chain shows coordination between the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office, the DOJ OIG, and the BOP's Reentry Services Division regarding obtaining this report.
